subject: Public Speaking
title: The Spotlight Effect
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Spotlight Effect.

hook.text: You think everyone notices your mistakes on stage. Research says they barely notice at all.

buildup.text: Psychologists call this the spotlight effect: we overestimate how much others observe and judge our behavior.

discovery.text: In experiments, people wearing embarrassing T-shirts thought 50% noticed. Actual rate: about 25%.

twist.text: On stage, the effect amplifies. Speakers remember every stumble. Audiences forget them within seconds.

climax.text: Knowing about the spotlight effect doesn't eliminate the feeling, but it does reduce its power over time.

punchline.text: You're the only one replaying your mistakes.

quiz.question: What is the spotlight effect?
options: Literally needing a spotlight on stage
Overestimating how much others notice your mistakes
